org.divxdede.text

Class TimeFormat

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.text.Format
      • org.divxdede.text.TimeFormat
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Cloneable

    public class TimeFormat
extends Format
    TimeFormat is a concrete class for formatting and parsing delay in a specified TimeUnit like MILLISECONDS, SECONDS, ...

    A delay is formated like this scheme 15d 21h 45m 32s 475ms 258?s 779ns
    It's canonized in order to use greatest unit as possible.

    Since:
    0.2
    Author:
    André Sébastien (divxdede)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • TimeFormat

        public TimeFormat()
        Default Constructor with a MILLISECONDS timeformat

      • TimeFormat

        public TimeFormat(TimeUnit unit)
        TimeFormat constructor for a specified unit.

        The Format.format(Object) will format a delay as (Number expressed in the specified TimeUnit.
        The Format.parseObject(String) parse a string and result a delay as (Number expressed in the specified TimeUnit.

        Parameters:
        unit - Time Unit that will be used by this TimeFormat for configure format & parse behaviour

    • Method Detail

      • format

        public String format(long delay,
            TimeUnit unit)
        Formats a delay expressed in a specified unit with this TimeFormat.
        TimeUnit onversions from finer to coarser granularities truncate, so lose precision.
        Parameters:
        delay - Delay to format
        unit - TimeUnit of the specified delay
        Returns:
        Formatted string.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the Format cannot format the given object

      • format

        public StringBuffer format(Object obj,
                  StringBuffer toAppendTo,
                  FieldPosition pos)
        Formats an object and appends the resulting text to a given string buffer. If the pos argument identifies a field used by the format, then its indices are set to the beginning and end of the first such field encountered.
        Specified by:
        format in class Format
        Parameters:
        obj - The object to format
        toAppendTo - where the text is to be appended
        pos - A FieldPosition identifying a field in the formatted text
        Returns:
        the string buffer passed in as toAppendTo, with formatted text appended
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if toAppendTo or pos is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if the Format cannot format the given object

      • parseObject

        public Object parseObject(String source,
                 ParsePosition pos)
        Parses text from a string to produce an object.

        The method attempts to parse text starting at the index given by pos. If parsing succeeds, then the index of pos is updated to the index after the last character used (parsing does not necessarily use all characters up to the end of the string), and the parsed object is returned. The updated pos can be used to indicate the starting point for the next call to this method. If an error occurs, then the index of pos is not changed, the error index of pos is set to the index of the character where the error occurred, and null is returned.

        Specified by:
        parseObject in class Format
        Parameters:
        source - A String, part of which should be parsed.
        pos - A ParsePosition object with index and error index information as described above.
        Returns:
        An Object parsed from the string. In case of error, returns null.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if pos is null.

      • getTimeUnit

        public TimeUnit getTimeUnit()
        Return the TimeUnit used by this TimeFormat.

        The Format.format(Object) will format a delay as (Number expressed in the returned TimeUnit.
        The Format.parseObject(String) parse a string and result a delay as (Number expressed in the returned TimeUnit.
